Manx: Paart dy Cheayrtyn ta Sleih Dobberan.
Diplomatic: Paart dy cheayrtyn ta sleih doberan son dy vel bodjalyn cheet harrish doo.

Manx: Paart dy cheayrtyn ta sleih dobberan son dy vel bodjalyn çheet harrishdoo. Bare lhieu yn vea ock dy vel ooilley soilshean greiney. T’ad jarrood dy vel boayl nagh vel bodjalyn erskyn, dy vel eh ny aasagh fo, lesh çhiass loshtee greiney as geayghyn çheh as neu-follan, fegooish biljyn as fadane, as gennish fegooish faiyr, ny lossreeyn erbee; boayl nagh vel bodjalyn er yn aer.
English: Sometimes people lament because clouds come over them. They would prefer their lives to be all sunshine. They forget that a place that doesn’t have clouds above is a desert beneath, with the burning heat of the sun and hot and unhealthy winds, without trees and desolate, and barren without grass or herbs at all; a place where the sky has no clouds.
Diplomatic: Paart dy cheayrtyn ta sleih doberan son dy vel bodjalyn cheet harrish doo. bare lieu yn vea ock dy vel ooilley soljean ghrainey. Ta’d jarrood dy vel boayl nagh vel bodjalyn er skiyn, dy vel eh ny aasagh fo, lesh chas loshtee ghrainey as gheayghen chea as neufollan, fegooish Biljyn as fadane, as genish fegoish faiyrny lodderyn erbee boayl nagh vel bodjalyn er yn aer. Ta ny bodjalyn chur dooin fynnagh voish chass loshtee yn ghrian.

Manx: Ta ny bodjalyn cur dooin fynneraght voish chiass loshtee yn ghrian. Ta ny bodjalyn cur dooin fliaghey dy ooraghey yn thalloo sponkit. Ta ny bodjalyn lhiggey sheese er ny croink as coanyn yn aasagh. Ta ny bodjalyn cur sheese orrin ass nyn dashtaghyn berçhys ny awinyn as yn faarkey, as deayrtey ad sheese orrin.
English: The clouds give us cooling from the burning heat of the sun. The clouds give us rain to freshen the dried up land. The clouds set down on the hills and the valleys of the desert. The clouds bring down upon us from their stores of wealth the rivers and the ocean, and pour them down on us.
Diplomatic: Ta ny bodjalyn cur dooin flaighey dy ooraghey yn thalloo sponkyt Ta ny bodjalyn lhiggey sheese er ny croink as coanyn yn aasagh. Ta ny bodjalyn cur sheese orryn as nyn dashgaghyn berches ny awinyn as yn faarkey, as deartey ad sheese orryn.

Manx: Booise dy row gys Jee, son ny bodjalyn, agh tra ta shiu tayrn gys cooinaghtyn dy vel yn Çhiarn eh hene grian as myrgeddin scape, as dy vel bodjalyn as dorraghys mygeayrt-y-mysh, as cairys as briwnys, coamrey e stoyl reeoil, as myr ta ny bodjalyn echey coodagh sollysid nyn mea, t’ad coyrt lesh bannaghtyn noa, lheid as nagh jinnagh shin dy bragh cosney fo aer ta fegooish bodjalyn, raad ta’n ghrian soilshean, as dy chooilley red goll er nyn doshiaght dy mie, as shoh myr ta croshyn çheet orrin ayns yn seihll shoh tra ta shin gaase taitnyssagh er, dy hayrn nyn aignaghyn gys reddyn ta dy bragh farraghtyn ayns Niau
English: Thanks be to God, for the clouds, but when you  remember, that the Lord himself is a sun and also a shield, and that there are clouds and darkness around about him, and justice and judgment, covering his throne, and as his clouds cover the brightness of our lives, they bring new blessings, such as we would never get from a sky without clouds, where the sun shines, and everything progresses well, and this is why troubles happen to us in this world, when we grow fond of it, to draw our minds to things that are everlasting in Heaven.
Diplomatic: Booise dy row gys Jee, son ny bodjalyn, agh tra ta shiu tayrn gys cooinniaghtyn. Dy vel yn Chiarn ehene ghrain as morgheddyn Scaape, as dy vel Bodjalyn as dorraghys mygeayrt y mysh, as cairys as briwnys, choamrey y stoal Reeoil, as mor ta ny bodjallyn eck eh coadagh sollysid nyn mea, ta’d churt lesh bannaghtyn noa, lheid as nagh jeanagh shin dy braagh costney fo aer ta fegoish bodjalyn., raaid ta’n ghrain soljean, as dy chooilley red gholl er nyn doshaght dy mie, as shoh mor ta chroshyn cheet orryn ayns yn seihll shoh, tra ta shin gaase taitnysagh er dy hayrn nyn aignaghyn gys redyn ta dy braagh farraghtyn ayns Niau
